snippets.central: Motion to Rename the 'Prince Andrew' Wikipedia article to Andrew Mountbatten Windsor
snippets.arg_timing: Timing: immediate rename vs wait until process completes.
snippets.arg_common: Usage: follow COMMONNAME vs follow the palace announcement.
snippets.arg_authority: Authority: King’s prerogative vs legal formalities.
snippets.t_sup_1: “Prince Andrew will now be known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor.”
snippets.t_sup_3: “What purpose to have Wikipedia lag behind reality?”
snippets.t_opp_1: “Too soon… Andrew has not been removed of his title yet.”
snippets.t_opp_2: “WP:TOOSOON — the process has started, not finished.”
snippets.t_opp_3: “Give it a few months and we’ll see what happens.”
snippets.c_sup_1: “COMMONNAME = what RS use; many have dropped ‘Prince’.”
snippets.c_sup_2: “NCROY: do not use hypothetical, dissolved or defunct titles.”
snippets.c_sup_3: “BLP/NPOV: calling him ‘Prince’ now is misleading; say ‘formerly’.”
snippets.c_opp_1: “Prince Andrew remains the common name after 65 years.”
snippets.c_opp_2: “Sources are still calling him ‘Prince’ in reports right now.”
snippets.a_sup_1: “The monarch can modify or revoke styles without Parliament.”
snippets.a_sup_2: “Charles was King immediately on QEII’s death — same immediacy.”
snippets.a_sup_3: “Present tense: ‘will now be known as’ ⇒ immediate effect.”
snippets.a_opp_1: “Requires Act of Parliament and Royal Assent.”
snippets.a_opp_2: “Wait for letters patent / London Gazette entries.”
snippets.a_opp_3: “‘Initiated a formal process’ — ambiguous, not done yet.”
snippets.f_sup_1: “Official statement has no hyphen — use ‘Mountbatten Windsor’.”
